headline: Snickerdoodles V
description: Is there anyone who doesn't like snickerdoodles? This recipe is a classic.
name: Snickerdoodles V

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets.

In a medium bowl, cream together the shortening and sugar. Add eggs one at a time, mixing after each. Sift together the flour, baking soda, cream of tartar and salt; stir into the creamed mixture until well blended.

In a small shallow bowl, stir together the 2 tablespoons of sugar with the cinnamon. Roll the dough into walnut sized balls and roll the balls in the sugar mixture. Place cookies 2 inches apart on the prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Cookies should be slightly golden at the edges. Remove to cool on wire racks.

review.reviewBody: Followed the recipe exactly and got delicious chewy cookies that are always a big hit. Only problem is they disappear so quickly!
Who wouldn't like these? Instant favorite!
I

Absolutely delicious. I was worried about no vanilla in the ingredients, but they’re great! I did use 1/2 C butter and 1/2 C shortening. Thanks for the great recipe….almost as good as what my grandma used to make.
Just love making these cookies! An easy recipe for a beginner or a pro. Everyone loves snickerdoodles…perfect for any occasion!
What a DISAPPOINTMENT! The dough was entirely too soft, even after refrigerating. They ran all over the cookie sheet. Will find a different recipe. A waste of time and ingredients.
Soft & chewy. I baked it in the air fryer at 325F for 5-6 mins. I sprinkled extra cinnamon sugar after baking. Best to bake on ungreased pan.
Wonderful, everyone loved them!
A big hit with friends and family! Such an easy cookie to make and it tastes great. Didn’t have shortening so used butter instead, otherwise followed recipe as is. Added this one to my favorites!
They taste great however, after a few of them the texture starts to feel a little weird
with the recipe it was really good but they were kinda dry
My favorite Snickerdoodle recipe! Soft and chewy, I like to add fresh nutmeg to mine
Everyone loves these cookies! I added extra cinnamon but made no other changes.

This is my version of the Snickerdoodle V. I used a small ice cream scoop (1/4 cup) and the cookies came out about 4 inches wide. These are the absolute favorite of my Godson Gabe and he loved them. The photo is by my Goddaughter Jenn Johnson of Jenn Marie Photography.
The dough was very crumbly, i made it a second time to ensure there were no mistakes and it came out the same way.

These turned out FANTASTIC, absolutely wonderful flavor. I loved the texture - I had left them in about an extra 90 seconds which caused them to crack on top. they had soft middles and chewy, crispy outsides. The cream of tartar adds a lot. I've tried recipes without it but these are better. Because at their core they are butter/sugar cookies, I used butter instead of shortening. I used salted and used only a 1/8th teaspoon of salt.
I loved it. It was the best 5hing that has been in my mouth. It's even better than the schools Snickerdoodles.
These were so good! My whole family loved them!
It was really fun and easy, really delicious, maybe the best cookies I have ever made!
Ilove these cookies they are easy to make
Mine tasted like dough with sugar. I must have made it wrong because i did not like mine. I wanted to make them for a cookie exchange and i failed making these cookies.
This was a great recipe. I shortened the bake time by about 3 minutes so the cookies would not be as crunchy. This will vary, depending on your oven. I find no fault in the recipe.

Just like other reviewers, I used 1/2 c. shortening and 1/2 c. butter (instead of 1 c. shortening) and added 1 teas. of vanilla. Also chilled the dough before making the balls for baking. Turned out great. Thanks for recipe.

I will TOTALY make it again! It was amazing, I just won a contest with it, in fact! I paired it with white and normal chocolate.

It was a little dry, but the judges didn't mind!
No changes. Great! I like them on the softer side, so 8 minutes was perfect.

This was a phenomenal recipe. I substituted the shortening for 2 sticks of softened butter. I also added a pinch of cinnamon to the dough. I also added a tablespoon of brown sugar. Thank you for this recipe!

Best cookies I ever made for the grandchildren! I exactly followed the directions and ingredients. Each batch makes 30 large cookies. The first batch lasted about 9 minutes. I had to make 2 more batches that day! Thumbs Up! Tommy C.

Not to brag or anything, but I made the most amazing snickerdoodles I’ve ever made using this recipe just the other night. It’s literally amazing, and y’all have to try it. My only suggestion would be to maybe bake them for a tiny bit less time than the recommendation, but thats definitely up to your preference. My oven tends to be a little on the hotter side so I almost burned them but they were still awesome.
Will definitely make it again!! I made mine purple! Yes you read it right purple! It's mother's day & I like purple.

These are SUPER good. Make sure you add the cream of tartar to get the nice cracked texture. I always add a pinch more than the recipe calls for. I didn’t have eggs, only a carton of egg whites. I used about 5 oz (weight) of egg whites and I added 2 Tbs of butter milk to replace the fat of the yolk. It worked like a champ! So crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, but not too sweet.

This recipe was very good. I needed a shortening recipe because I only had a stick of butter. I ended up using 1/4 cup butter and 1 3/4 cup shortening for a double recipe. It will not replace my Mrs Sigg’s recipe from this site but it was a very good recipe when I needed to use mostly shortening. I’m typically only a butter baked. I used the middle sized Pampered Chef scoop and the full 10 minutes was perfect. I used parchment, because I always do. Thanks for the recipe!
yes

I made a few mistakes making this, but they still turned out amazing. I used butter instead of shortening, but the taste and texture is great. I also forgot the cream of tartar, and I thought all hope was lost. They didn’t have the nice crack, but they were puffed up without being too thick. I also cut down the flour by 1/4 cup and I’m glad I did. Dough was perfect— more flour would’ve made it too thick in my opinion. 9 min was ideal baking time. Overall, butter isn’t that big of a deal.
Didnt have any cream of tartar so didnt use it .Used l/4 tsp lemon juice instead. I used butter instead of shortening, and put 2 tsp baking powder instead of 1 of baking soda. Delicious!!
This is the BEST snickerdoodle recipe I’ve found. I follow the recipe exactly and they come out perfect every single time. Delicious!
Made them exactly as instructed, with just a dash of added vanilla. SO YUMMY!
Perfect, every time!
nice and soft fluffy and perfectly cracked thank you
Easy and tasty. Added about extra 1/2 cup of flour. Great to not have to chill prior to rolling!
Perfect cookie, no need to make any changes to recipe. Soft, delightful, tasty!
These are delicious. I made exactly as written and they were perfect. Definitely a keeper.
I followed the directions exactly but it ended up being super dry and crumbly, it was horrible, I couldn't even roll it into balls, the dough disintegrated in my hands.
Great cookie. An all time favorite in your house.

Yummy! I used salted butter instead of shortening, which I don't have, and kept the original amount of salt. I made sure to cream the butter and sugar and eggs for at least 3 minutes, or until it looked very fluffy! It was a bit difficult to mix the flour in there with it, but wow they turned out so gloriously tasty! I baked for 8 minutes and, using a number 50 scoop, got 43 cookies. Will make again!

This is a fail safe recipe. Admittedly, I felt a bit over indulgent adding 1 C shortening (oh my!) but it does keep the cookies tender the next day, if they last that long. And the flavor is fantastic whether you used regular ol' shortening or butter flavored. My husband and kids keep asking for more!

This is a must in my house. I love this recipe but I followed the tips given my the views by adding vanilla. Instead of shortening I made it with half shortening and half butter. It works and my family can't get enough.
I love this recipe!!! When I made them though, I didn't role the balls into the sugar and cinnamon. I pressed a small cup into the cinnamon and sugar and then pressed it into the cookies.
These are perfect!

Yummy! 
Just like Mom used to make.
Changes I made: no shortening, all unsalted butter; doubled baking soda; omitted salt; chilled overnight (ran out of time); baked exactly 8 minutes and immediately slid parchment paper and cookies on to cooling racks.
Wouldn't make any changes at all. This is a great recipe!

I used Kerrygold salted butter omitted the salt and shortening. They were PERFECT! I used a cookie scoop so we got 3 1/2 dozen out of the batch. This was our tenth year and tenth recipe for our annual cookiefest, I am so glad we finally found a keeper.

Also, I frosted one with some left over buttercream and OMG. BEST. COOKIE. EVER!
The butter was a mistake...If you like cakey cookies....I like flatter, chewier cookies so need to use shortening... and i like vanilla in everthing.....

This was an easy recipe to follow and made a good cookie. I left the first sheet in the oven a bit too long, even though they looked just right. They came out crispy, which was ok, but I like a chewier cookie. I just put a slice of bread in the container when I stored them and they came out a bit chewier.

I coated the dough balls in a mixture of 5 t cinnamon, 5 t brown sugar, 1/8 t of cardamom and a pinch of salt; might use white sugar mixed with brown, just to mix it up more easily. Butter-flavored shortening was fine, but might use real butter next time.

If you are rating a recipe and are changing the ingredients, then it not an accurate review. I followed this recipe and did not change anything. I baked them for eight minutes and they came out great! I will definitely make these again.
I made these, and they came out amazing! I only baked them for 8 minutes. They came out perfect. I will keep this Snickerdoodle recipe in my book, for the next time.
wonderful! easy recipe - my 11 year old made it!
I will definitely make it again!
Very easy to make!
Wonderful recipe. They would make great sugar cookies too.

These are absolutely delicious. I made a double recipe for about 45 middle school kids. I'm so excited because I know they will love them. They turned out fantastic by following the recipe exactly as written. No changes needed even at high altitude (8500 ft). That is often a challenge, but not with this recipe. Thank you!

THANK YOU for this recipe. I have made this countless number of times and it's always a hit! Especially at the office or with my family. I use crisco butter flavor sticks. I also add 1 teaspoon of vanilla when I add the eggs. Otherwise, fantastic snickerdoodle!

My husbands favorite cookie. First year I ever made it. Had to make 4 batches he and everyone that had them couldn't stop eating them. I was told they were the softest snickerdoodles anyone ever tatsed. Will make every year now!
Great recipe! I only gave 4 stars because to make this perfect I think butter AND shortening is needed. 1/2 cup of each creamed with the sugar. No additional changes. Perfection!
My daughter ended up making snicker doodle balls because the recipe doesn't say to flatten the balls before baking & she had never made them before. And they tasted flat. Not sweet at all.

I used butter flavored shortening, otherwise followed exactly, with time adjustment for my oven. Ended up with lightly rounded cookies with attractive cracks in the surface, crisp on the outside, soft and chewy inside. Perfect recipe.
I did not make any changes and they turned out great! the dough was easy to roll and the cookies held up to the exact size. These are my daughter's favorite.
This was a very good recipe. It was a little dry and puffy. I'd say it needs to be more moist.....
Fantastic!!!! I used butter instead of shortning.
These have become a family favorite and even requested by people at my spouse's office. Easy, delicious!
I added vanilla and half a cup of butter and they were too dry!

What a simple recipe with a delicious result. I'll definitely be making these again!

P.S. - I didn't make any changes.
The taste of the shortening was the dominant taste. They looked good.

Perfect recipe . I always use this recipe and never fail. It is easy and the cookies come out perfect . Just don't overtake . If you set the temperature and time as the recipe said, the texture will be chewy inside and crispy outside.
Easy recipe and spot-on perfect results.
They were awful. No issue with the texture or appearance but these are AWFUL!

I LOVE this recipe!!! I make it all the time. It is soooo AMAZING!!! I could eat a thousand of them and I don't really have a sweet tooth. And I am glad it makes so many. I make about 4 dozen eat time I cook these. Every one should make these. I love them. Thank you too the person who created this recipe. THANK YOU!!!
I used 1/2 cup butter and 1/2 cup shortening instead of the one cup shortening. They still came out delicious with a richer flavor. My husband loves these and requests them frequently.

This is the favorite cookie in my house!
 I press the dough into the cinnamon & sugar mixture twice. After the first pressing I set it to the side and let the cinnamon & sugar latch onto the moisture from the dough then I recoat them. :) yumyumyum

A few changes to accommodate my needs: 1. Substituted 1T baking powder and 1/2 t baking soda for the cream of tartar and soda listed in the recipe. 2. Added about a T real maple syrup. 3. I have a teeny tiny oven and dark cookie sheets, so I turned the temp down to 350, baked the cookies for 8 minutes, then opened the door (turned the oven off) and let them sit for a few minutes more (I was only making one pan... The rest of the dough went in the fridge for a later time). They were wonderful!!!! A little crunchy around the edges, chewy on the inside - hum-yum!!
This recipe is awesome, I didn't have Cream of Tartar so I omitted the baking soda and used baking powder in place of both. They came out perfect. Soft and chewy, very tasty.
My favorite snickerdoodles recipe.The only change I make is I roll half the cookies in plain sugar because my husband doesn’t like cinnamon.

These are delicious. I followed the recipe exactly except for using half butter and half Crisco and adding 1 tsp of vanilla as others had suggested. I baked for 8 minutes exactly and they came out perfectly.
Easy and super delicious!! This will be my go-to recipe for Snickerdoodles in the future!
This recipe is okay but really dry. Add one more egg and it is perfect after that. If you have cavities be careful! I had one and now my tooth hurts.
This recipe is great!
I have been using this recipe for about 6 years now. I have made this recipe for an assisted living building of 80+ residents as well as my cookie swaps. People look forward to them :)

After years of baking cookies for Christmas, I vowed never again to make snickerdoodles. Year after year they were the biggest disappointment. I bake 1000's of cookies for family, and these always defeated me! NOT ANY MORE! Thank you Amy for posting this recipe. These cookies turned out perfect. The only thing I did different was added vanilla and cut out the salt. The texture is very pleasing, and the ease of the recipe is wonderful. I doubled the recipe in a leap of faith and I am happy to add these to my cookie bar on Christmas Eve!
These cookies were OK, but they tasted a little raw when I cooked them for 9 minutes. I lowered the temperature and cooked it for 1 more minute, but they burned. I had to make double the dough.
Amazing snickerdoodle recipe! Loved it! Thanks for sharing!
I added 1/2 cup toasted chopped pecans to the dough and it amped up the taste and was a crowd pleaser :)
Taste exactly as they should. Lactose free, which is good for our household. The dough was a little dry and at times difficult to roll into balls.
Didn't rise. Tasted like french toast. Chewy.

This is a very good cookie I used butter flavored crisco and 1/4 cup more flour because of our elevation an they turned out delicious don't think their going to make it tell tomorrow though they seem to be disappearing !

These snickerdoodles are a family favorite!

I followed one reviewer's suggestion and put the balls of dough in a plastic baggie w/the cinnamon and sugar, then shook to coat. They turned out perfect! I made these twice, and both times, they went like hotcakes!
While the flavor is good, the cookies came out way too thin!
They looked great but they were way too salty and tasted more like shortbread than snicker doodles. Not impressed :(

I love this recipe! I've made it twice now and the first time I did it as instructed and it was wonderful but the second time I creamed the 1/2 butter 1/2 shortening 
and sugars then added the vanilla and egg. And I think the biggist difference is that once both eggs were added I mixed it on high until a stiff mousse was formed them gentaly folded in all the sifted drys. I then refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours (covered) then bake.They turn out to be the softest, with just a hint of chewy
I followed directions exactly and the dough was to sticky and melted into a giant blob while cooking!
